net.antidot.paf

Interface Document


  • public interface Document
    This class represents a Document.
    Version:
    7.4
    Author:
    Laurent Mazuel

    • Method Detail

      • get_uri

        String get_uri()
        The uri.
        Returns:
        The uri.

      • set_uri

        void set_uri(String new_uri)
        Setting a new uri for this document. Note that the uri is really changed only when the document is pushed/synced/saved
        Parameters:
        new_uri - A new uri

      • get_layer

        Layer get_layer(LayerType.Type type)
        The given layer in this document.
        Parameters:
        type - The layer type.
        Returns:
        The layer, or null if layer is not defined.

      • set_layer

        boolean set_layer(byte[] data,
                LayerType.Type layer_type,
                String mimetype,
                String encoding,
                String origin_uri)
        Set a byte content as a layer in this document.
        Parameters:
        data - The byte data of this layer.
        layer_type - The layer type.
        mimetype - The mimetype. Can be null.
        encoding - The encoding. Can be null.
        origin_uri - The origin uri (of not same as uri document). Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if insertion was possible.
        See Also:
        set_layer(String, LayerType.Type, String, String, String)

      • set_layer

        boolean set_layer(String data,
                LayerType.Type layer_type,
                String mimetype,
                String encoding,
                String origin_uri)
        Set a string content as a layer in this document.
        Parameters:
        data - The string data of this layer.
        layer_type - The layer type.
        mimetype - The mimetype. Can be null.
        encoding - The encoding. Can be null.
        origin_uri - The origin uri (of not same as uri document). Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if insertion was possible.
        See Also:
        set_layer(byte[], LayerType.Type, String, String, String)

      • has_layer

        boolean has_layer(LayerType.Type type)
        Test if this document has the given layer.
        Parameters:
        type - the layer type.
        Returns:
        true if layer exists, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • get_doc_id

        long get_doc_id()
        Get the doc_id of this document.
        Returns:
        The doc_id.

      • get_PaF_id

        long get_PaF_id()
        Get the current PaF id of this document. Note that it can be different from Pipe_Info.get_current_PaF_id() if this document came from methods like Handle.get_by_PaF_id(int, java.util.Set).
        Returns:
        The PaF_id of this document.

      • get_previous_PaF_id

        long get_previous_PaF_id()
        The previous PaF id of this document, or 0 if this PaF is not incremental.
        Returns:
        The previous PaF_id

      • get_x_id

        Return the x tag.
        Returns:

      • get_revision

        Layer get_revision(LayerType.Type type,
                 int revision_number)
        Get a read-only old layer
        Parameters:
        type - The type wanted
        revision_number - The revision number
        Returns:
        A local copy of this old layer
        Throws:
        E_user - If no layer exists for this type.
        See Also:
        has_layer(net.antidot.protobuf.paf.layer.LayerType.Type), get_revisions_metadata(net.antidot.protobuf.paf.layer.LayerType.Type)

      • get_revisions_metadata

        List<RevisionMetadata> get_revisions_metadata(LayerType.Type type)
        Get list of revisions metadata for a given type. The index in the vector is the revision number.
        Parameters:
        type - The type wanted
        Returns:
        The vector of revisions metadata
        Throws:
        E_user - If no layer exists for this type.
        See Also:
        has_layer(net.antidot.protobuf.paf.layer.LayerType.Type), get_revision(net.antidot.protobuf.paf.layer.LayerType.Type, int)

      • get_creation_date

        Date get_creation_date()
        Return the creation data of this document.
        Returns:
        The creation date of this document.

      • copy

        Document copy()
        Return a copy of this document without its layer. Useful to only keep metadata.
        Returns:
        A layer-free copy of this document.
